qas.question: What analogies did Feynman use to teach Carl?
Which subject did Feynman and Carl both enjoy?
What type of computing did Feynman and his son help develop?
What Laboratory employed Feynman for critical missions?
What fictional character was Feynman compared to by a colleague?
What analogies did Feynman not utilize to teach Carl?
Which subject did Feynman and Carl both dislike?
What type of computing did Feynman and his dad help develop?
What Laboratory employed Feynman for unimportant missions?
What fictional character was Feynman compared to by his son?

context: Feynman had a great deal of success teaching Carl, using, for example, discussions about <a0_0><b5_0>ants and Martians<b5_0/><a0_0/> as a device for gaining perspective on problems and issues. He was surprised to learn that the same teaching devices were not useful with Michelle. <a1_0><b6_0>Mathematics<b6_0/><a1_0/> was a common interest for father and son; they both entered the computer field as consultants and were involved in advancing a new method of using multiple computers to solve complex problems—later known as <a2_0><b7_0>parallel computing<b7_0/><a2_0/>. <a3_0><b8_0>The Jet Propulsion Laboratory<b8_0/><a3_0/> retained Feynman as a computational consultant during critical missions. One co-worker characterized Feynman as akin to <a4_0><b9_0>Don Quixote<b9_0/><a4_0/> at his desk, rather than at a computer workstation, ready to do battle with the windmills.
